summary.p: The Microsoft Build Engine is a platform for building applications. This engine, which is also known as MSBuild, provides an XML schema for a project file that controls how the build platform processes and builds software. Visual Studio uses MSBuild, but it doesn't depend on Visual Studio. By invoking msbuild.exe on your project or solution file, you can orchestrate and build products in environments where Visual Studio isn't installed. Visual Studio uses MSBuild to load and build managed projects. The project files in Visual Studio (.csproj,.vbproj, vcxproj, and others) contain MSBuild XML code that executes when you build a project by using the IDE. Visual Studio projects import all the necessary settings and build processes to do typical development work, but you can extend or modify them from within Visual Studio or by using an XML editor.
For more details, visit the official website.

Visual Studio projects import all the necessary settings and build processes to do typical development work, but you can extend or modify them from within Visual Studio or by using an XML editor.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.Is64Bit
member.summary: Returns whether the operating system is x64 or not.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.Is32Bit
member.summary: Returns whether the operating system is x86 or not.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.IsUnix
member.summary: Returns whether the operating system is a UNIX system.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.IsWin
member.summary: Returns whether the operating system is a Windows system.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.Framework
member.summary: Returns the framework the build is running on.

member.name: P:Nuke.Core.EnvironmentInfo.Platform
member.summary: Returns the platform the build is running on.
